meanings.definition: (Greek mythology) The name of two individuals in Greek mythology: 1. A son of Pheres and the brother of Lycomedes. He was one of the Argonauts. 2. The father of Opis, the defender of Artemis.
meanings.english_definition: (Greek mythology) 1. A son of Pheres and the brother of Lycomedes. He was one of the Argonauts. 2. The father of Opis, the defender of Artemis.

etymology.value: From the Greek Περιμήδης (Perimḗdēs), possibly meaning 'very cunning' or 'very wise'.
